intro: Blastocaulon prostratum, commonly known as the prostrate bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with thin, ribbon-like leaves that float on the surface of still or slow-moving freshwater. The plant produces small, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. These bladders are typically found in clusters at the ends of the stems. Blastocaulon prostratum is often found in nutrient-rich, shallow waters and is an important part of the aquatic ecosystem.
